qas.question: What was the name of Hannibal's family member that wanted to join his army in battle?
At what river was Hasdrubal Barca defeated at?
In which battle was Hannibal clearly defeated at?
Who had led the army that the Romans had sent to Africa?
Why did the Romans send an army to Africa?

context: The Romans held off Hannibal in three battles, but then Hannibal smashed a succession of Roman consular armies. By this time Hannibal's brother <a0_0>Hasdrubal Barca<a0_0/> sought to cross the Alps into Italy and join his brother with a second army. Hasdrubal managed to break through into Italy only to be defeated decisively on the <a1_0>Metaurus River<a1_0/>. Unable to defeat Hannibal on Italian soil, the Romans boldly sent an army to Africa under <a3_0>Scipio Africanus<a3_0/> <a4_0>to threaten the Carthaginian capital<a4_0/>. Hannibal was recalled to Africa, and defeated at <a2_0>the Battle of Zama<a2_0/>.
